extendedIngredients.name: artichoke hearts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped

extendedIngredients.name: frozen spinach
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed

recipes.title: Baked Spinach Artichoke Dip

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are my top picks for Dip. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. You could try Bellissima Sparkling rosé. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).                            In a medium bowl, combine spinach, artichoke hearts, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, white pepper, and lemon juice. Mix well, and spoon mixture into a 1 quart baking dish. Top with remaining 1/4 cup parmesan cheese.                            Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a medium bowl, combine spinach, artichoke hearts, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, white pepper, and lemon juice.
Mix well, and spoon mixture into a 1 quart baking dish. Top with remaining 1/4 cup parmesan cheese.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until hot and bubbly.
